column4: Hi all! Is there a way, when I try to enable desktop effects in Feisty, to stop package manager from installing nvidia-glx ?
Why do you want nvidia-glx not installed?
because I installed the latest 100.14.11 from nvidia.
You can just tell it not to load the one from restricted modules
how do I do that ?
I believe it's in /etc/default/linux-restricted-modules-common
I should edit linux-restricted-modules-common not to download? where exactly in the file? do you happen to know?
add it to where it says DISABLED_MODULES
so I add "nvidia-glx" in DISABLED_MODULES ?
Yes
thank you very much I'll try it (lol sorry but i'm a noob :) )
No problem :) You know that you have to re-install whenever there is a kernel upgrade if you don't use the Ubuntu package for nvidia right?
yes I know that, but LOL I don't know how to tell when a kernel update happened and what exactly is a kernel :D
I have installed Ubuntu Feisty for about .... 10 days now, I'm an UBER-Noob
That is why I generally recommend people use the Ubuntu packages even if they are a little older
you have a point but the problem is that 'I have problems with X module and Nvidia kernel module
whenever I try to enable Desktop Effects I get the error message GDM Failed to start
both nvidia-glx and nvidia-glx-new
Was that only with the packaged drivers?
yes, or at least I think so [missed an a there]
so I did sudo nano /etc/x11/xorg.conf and change driver to "nv"
:) Yeeeaaay! I learned something new today... tab completion :D thanks
